title: CV Data Management System
text:
This project uses a data-driven approach to manage CV content, allowing you to maintain your CV data in one place (cv-data.yml) and automatically generate format-specific renderings for both HTML and PDF.



cv-data.yml - Single source of truth for all CV content (education, publications, talks, experience)
generate-cv.py - Python script that reads YAML and generates Quarto-compatible markdown
cv-sections-generated.qmd - Auto-generated file (don’t edit directly!)
index.qmd - Main document that includes the generated content
template.tex - LaTeX template for professional PDF formatting
build.sh - Build script that regenerates everything





Edit cv-data.yml - All your CV data is stored here in structured YAML format
Run build.sh - Automatically:

Runs generate-cv.py to create format-specific renderings
Renders PDF with dates on the right side
Renders HTML website
Copies files to docs/





To add or update content:

Edit cv-data.yml (add a publication, talk, job, etc.)
Run sh build.sh
Done! Both HTML and PDF are updated




✓ Single source of truth - Edit data once, not twice
✓ Format-specific rendering - HTML gets links, PDF gets right-aligned dates
✓ Consistent formatting - Automatic styling for all entries
✓ Easy maintenance - No duplicate content to keep in sync
✓ Type safety - Structured YAML prevents formatting errors



publications:
  conference:
    - title: "Your Paper Title"
      authors: [SD Mis, Coauthor Name]
      venue: "Conference Name 2026"
      date: Jun 2026
      location: "City, Country"
      links:
        pdf: "https://example.com/paper.pdf"
        arxiv: "https://arxiv.org/abs/2345.67890"
Then run sh build.sh and both your website and PDF CV are updated!

title: David Mis
text:
News
I will be attending CBMS Conference on Research at the Interface of Applied Mathematics and Machine Learning (AMML) 2025 at the University of Houston, December 8–12, where I’ll present a poster regarding our recent work on measure flows in Bayes Hilbert spaces.
I am looking forward to Inverse Days in Helsinki, Finland, from December 16–18, 2025, where I will be giving a talk.
I am organizing a minisymposium with Nick Boffi titled Measure flows for Inverse Problems and Machine Learning (MS35, MS52, and MS68) at the SIAM Conference on Uncertainty Quantification to be held in Minneapolis from March 22–26, 2026.
